---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [94023204cf](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20471/commits/94023204cfbff004960b8ec75ea4dcb456186529)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Cotangent.map_toInfinitesimal_bijective`
`+ CotangentSpace.map_toInfinitesimal_bijective`
`+ H1Cotangent.equiv`
`+ H1Cotangent.equivOfFormallySmooth`
`+ H1Cotangent.map_toInfinitesimal_bijective`
`+ comap_cotangentIdeal`
`+ equivH1CotangentOfFormallySmooth`
`+ homInfinitesimal`
`+ infinitesimal`
`+ ker_infinitesimal`

`+ range_cotangentToQuotientSquare`
`+ toInfinitesimal`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

```suggestion
lemma mk_mem_cotangentIdeal {I : Ideal R} {x : R} :
```
I think this is easier to read.

```suggestion
/-- Maps `Pâ‚ â†’ Pâ‚‚` and `Pâ‚‚ â†’ Pâ‚` between extensions induce an isomorphism of `HÂ¹(L_{S/R})`. -/
```

I'm not sure what the best notation for "the cotangent complex associated to a presentation/versal infinitesimal extension" is before we establish the fact that they are homotopic. I have a slight feeling that `L_{S/R}` should only mean the contangent complex associated to the standard free resolution `R[S] -> S` but I'm not sure if this is important or not. If you think this distinction is unimportant then I'm happy to implement these.
Good point, maybe `HÂ¹(L_P)` is better then? So something like "induce an isomorphism `HÂ¹(L_Pâ‚) â‰ƒâ‚— HÂ¹(L_Pâ‚‚)`"?

```suggestion
      Extension.H1Cotangent.map_comp]; rfl
```
Should these go to an earlier file? Maybe just to `Mathlib.RingTheory.Extension`?

```suggestion
/-- Formally smooth extensions have isomorphic `HÂ¹(L_{S/R})`. -/
```

```suggestion
lemma CotangentSpace.bijective_map_toInfinitesimal (P : Extension.{u} R S) :
```
My understanding is that this is the right order, but we have a lot of lemmas named the other way round, so I am not sure.
I think we put `injective` and `surjective` and `bijective` at the end. See [here](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html#injectivity)
Ah thanks!

```suggestion
Given extensions `0 â†’ Iâ‚ â†’ Pâ‚ â†’ S â†’ 0` and `0 â†’ Iâ‚‚ â†’ Pâ‚‚ â†’ S â†’ 0` with `Pâ‚` formally smooth,
this is an arbitrarily chosen map `Pâ‚/Iâ‚Â² â†’ Pâ‚‚/Iâ‚‚Â²` of extensions.
```

```suggestion
def equivH1CotangentOfFormallySmooth (P : Extension R S) [FormallySmooth R P.Ring] :
```
maybe?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Smooth): calculate `HÂ¹(L)` via formally smooth extensions
